poem:
Title: "Phoenix Without a Dawn"

An inferno's footprints
upon a market's carcass,
a thousand voices silenced—
fish, swans, snakes,
even puppies, cockatoos, kittens.

Their spirits in cages,
consumed by an unasked-for blight.
A call for change ripples—
a lament in the ashes.

Beware! Our commerce 
holds more than coin,
holds life, holds death,
a balance tipping in the morning's fire-light.
